You probably don't want to write ARC files for this; they have always 
been designed to be a complete, verbatim record of server responses.

Instead, you'd want to write some other format, optimized for what you 
want dumped.

It turns out the example 'metadata' records of the WARC format are 
pretty close to what you want: among other information, they include a 
series of 'outlink' lines which include all outbound links, from which 
you could select just the A/@HREF or IMG/@SRC links.

However, while we added flags to WARCWriterProcessor to turn off 
'request' and 'metadata' writing (because that would approximate the ARC 
legacy 'response'-only writing), we didn't think to add a flag to turn 
off full 'response'-writing. So you'd probably want to add that in the 
code, so that only the 'metadata' records with the info you want are 
written.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA
